title: For Moist, Tender Carrot Cake, Make It the Brazilian Way
full_text:
For Moist, Tender Carrot Cake, Make It the Brazilian Way
Close
Jump to recipe
Prep
10 mins
Cook
55 mins
Cooling Time:
105 mins
Total
2 hrs 50 mins
Serves
10
Cook Mode
(Keep screen awake)
Ingredients
For the Cake:
Baking spray
with flour
3
medium
carrots
(
4
ounces
;
113
g
each), peeled and grated (about
2
cups
packed)
14
ounces
granulated sugar
(
400
g
;
2
cups
)
1
cup
(
240
ml
)
vegetable oil
3
large
eggs
8 1/2
ounces
all-purpose flour
(
240
g
;
1 3/4
cup
plus
2
tablespoons
)
1
tablespoon
baking powder
1
teaspoon
Diamond Crystal kosher salt
; for table salt, use half as much by volume
For the Frosting:
2
(3 1/2 ounce) cans
sweetened condensed milk
3/4
cup
(
180
ml
)
whole milk
1 1/2
ounces
unsweetened natural cocoa powder
(
42
g
;
1/2
cup
)
1
ounce
unsalted butter
(
28
g
;
2
tablespoons
), cut into 1-inch cubes
1/4
teaspoon
Diamond Crystal kosher salt
; for table salt, use half as much by volume
Chocolate sprinkles
(optional)
Directions
For the Cake:
Adjust oven rack to middle position and preheat oven to 350°F (175°C). Using baking spray, lightly grease bottom and sides of a 9-inch round cake pan; line bottom of pan with parchment paper.
In a blender or food processor, blend carrots, sugar, oil, and eggs until completely smooth, about 90 seconds. In a large bowl, whisk flour, baking powder, and salt together. Pour carrot mixture into flour mixture and whisk until combined and no lumps remain. Pour batter into prepared pan and gently tap to eliminate any air bubbles. Using an offset or flexible spatula, smooth batter into an even layer.
Serious Eats / Hannah Hufham
Serious Eats / Hannah Hufham
Bake until golden brown and a toothpick or cake tester inserted comes out clean, 45 to 50 minutes. Tent with aluminum foil, if needed, after 30 minutes to prevent overbrowning. Let cake cool in pan 15 minutes; invert cake onto a wire rack and let cool completely, about 1 hour.
For the Frosting
: In a small saucepan, whisk condensed milk, whole milk, cocoa powder, butter, and salt to combine. Cook over medium heat, stirring constantly, until mixture begins to bubble and has thickened slightly, about 5 minutes.
Serious Eats / Hannah Hufham
Immediately pour frosting over cooled cake, allowing it to drip down sides of cake. Garnish with chocolate sprinkles, if desired. Let frosting set before slicing and serving, at least 30 minutes.
Special Equipment
9-inch round cake pan, parchment paper, blender or food processor, whisk, toothpick or cake tester, wire rack, small saucepan
Notes
Cake can be baked in a Bundt pan or a 9- by 13-inch baking pan if desired. Baking time may vary; if baking in a 9- by 13-inch baking pan, bake until golden brown and a toothpick or cake tester inserted comes out clean, about 30 minutes.
Make-Ahead and Storage
Cake can be stored in an airtight container at room temperature for up to 3 days.
The cooled and unfrosted cake can be wrapped tight in plastic and frozen for up to 2 months. Let thaw in refrigerator overnight before frosting.
